alert.note: Alert for Lower Rio Grande Valley; South Central Highlands; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:23PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHEASTERN SOCORRO COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM MDT... At 522 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 21 miles northwest of Three Rivers, or 25 miles west of Carrizozo, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oscuro. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 46 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Lower Rio Grande Valley; South Central Highlands; Upper Tularosa Valley
